In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the letter **S** serves the following purposes:

- s represents an [arachnid or centipede](/wiki/Arachnid_or_centipede "Arachnid or centipede"):

  - s [cave spider](/wiki/Cave_spider "Cave spider")
  - s [centipede](/wiki/Centipede "Centipede")
  - s [giant spider](/wiki/Giant_spider "Giant spider")
  - s [scorpion](/wiki/Scorpion "Scorpion")
  - s [Scorpius](/wiki/Scorpius "Scorpius")

* S represents a [snake](/wiki/Snake_\(monster_class\) "Snake (monster class)"):

  - S [garter snake](/wiki/Garter_snake "Garter snake")
  - S [snake](/wiki/Snake "Snake")
  - S [water moccasin](/wiki/Water_moccasin "Water moccasin")
  - S [pit viper](/wiki/Pit_viper "Pit viper")
  - S [python](/wiki/Python "Python")
  - S [cobra](/wiki/Cobra "Cobra")

- Press [s]() to [search](/wiki/Search "Search") for [hidden](/wiki/Hide "Hide") [monsters](/wiki/Monster "Monster"), [traps](/wiki/Trap "Trap"), [secret doors](/wiki/Secret_door "Secret door") and passages.
- Press [S]() to [save](/wiki/Saving "Saving") your game and quit.
- When prompted for a direction, [s]() means "yourself".

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Historical uses](#Historical_uses)

- [2 Variants](#Variants)

  - [2.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [2.2 AceHack](#AceHack)
  - [2.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)

## Historical uses

In Hack 1.21, based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), [stalactoids](/index.php?title=Stalactoid\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Stalactoid (page does not exist)") use the s glyph, while [snowmen](/index.php?title=Snowmen\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Snowmen (page does not exist)") use the S glyph. In Hack for PDP-11, the l is given to the [giant scorpion](/wiki/Giant_scorpion "Giant scorpion"), while the S glyph is given to the [snake](/wiki/Snake "Snake") - the snake retains its glyph for its appearance in [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0"), while the giant scorpion is replaced with the regular [scorpion](/wiki/Scorpion "Scorpion"). Both monsters continue to use those glyphs up to [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e").

In [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), the arachnid or centipede [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") is introduced and uses the s glyph, with the scorpion made part of the monster class, while the snake monster class is introduced and given the S glyph.

## Variants

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") introduces new monsters that use the s and S glyphs:

- s arachnid or centipede

  - s [recluse spider](/wiki/Recluse_spider "Recluse spider")
  - s [barking spider](/wiki/Barking_spider "Barking spider")
  - s [carrion crawler](/wiki/Carrion_crawler "Carrion crawler")
  - s [nickelpede](/wiki/Nickelpede "Nickelpede")
  - s [giant scorpion](/wiki/Giant_scorpion "Giant scorpion")
  - s [Girtab](/wiki/Girtab "Girtab")
  - s [Shelob](/wiki/Shelob "Shelob")
  - s [phase spider](/wiki/Phase_spider "Phase spider")
  - @ / s [werespider](/wiki/Werespider "Werespider")

- S snake

  - S [king cobra](/wiki/King_cobra "King cobra")
  - @ / S [weresnake](/wiki/Weresnake "Weresnake")
  - S [asphynx](/wiki/Asphynx "Asphynx")

### AceHack

In [AceHack](/wiki/AceHack "AceHack"), [S]() can be used to quit with or without saving.

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") introduces several new monsters that use the s and S glyphs:

- s arachnid or centipede

  - s [mirkwood spider](/wiki/Mirkwood_spider "Mirkwood spider")
  - s [phase spider](/wiki/Phase_spider "Phase spider")
  - s [demonic black widow](/wiki/Demonic_black_widow "Demonic black widow")
  - s [mirkwood elder](/wiki/Mirkwood_elder "Mirkwood elder")
  - s [yurian](/wiki/Yurian "Yurian")
  - s [Shelob](/index.php?title=Shelob_\(dNetHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Shelob (dNetHack) (page does not exist)")
  - s [man-faced millipede](/index.php?title=Man-faced_millipede\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Man-faced millipede (page does not exist)")

- S snake

  - S [wraithworm](/index.php?title=Wraithworm\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Wraithworm (page does not exist)")
  - S [serpent man of Yoth](/index.php?title=Serpent_man_of_Yoth\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Serpent man of Yoth (page does not exist)")
  - S [daughter of Naunet](/index.php?title=Daughter_of_Naunet\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Daughter of Naunet (page does not exist)")
  - S [man-serpent soldier](/index.php?title=Man-serpent_soldier\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Man-serpent soldier (page does not exist)")
  - S [man-serpent mage](/index.php?title=Man-serpent_mage\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Man-serpent mage (page does not exist)")
  - S [man-serpent summoner](/index.php?title=Man-serpent_summoner\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Man-serpent summoner (page does not exist)")
  - S [man-serpent giant](/index.php?title=Man-serpent_giant\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Man-serpent giant (page does not exist)")
  - S [pisaca](/index.php?title=Pisaca\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Pisaca (page does not exist)")
  - S [first wraithworm](/index.php?title=First_wraithworm\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "First wraithworm (page does not exist)")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

S

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In NetHack, the letter S serves the following purposes:

  • s represents an arachnid or centipede:
    • s cave spider
    • s centipede
    • s giant spider
    • s scorpion
    • s Scorpius
  • S represents a snake:
    • S garter snake
    • S snake
    • S water moccasin
    • S pit viper
    • S python
    • S cobra
  • Press s to search for hidden monsters, traps, secret doors and passages.
  • Press S to save your game and quit.
  • When prompted for a direction, s means "yourself".

Contents

  • 1 Historical uses
  • 2 Variants
    • 2.1 SLASH'EM
    • 2.2 AceHack
    • 2.3 dNetHack

Historical uses

In Hack 1.21, based on Jay Fenlason's Hack, stalactoids use the s glyph, while snowmen use the S glyph. In Hack for PDP-11, the l is given to the giant scorpion, while the S glyph is given to the snake - the snake retains its glyph for its appearance in Hack 1.0, while the giant scorpion is replaced with the regular scorpion. Both monsters continue to use those glyphs up to NetHack 2.3e.

In NetHack 3.0.0, the arachnid or centipede monster class is introduced and uses the s glyph, with the scorpion made part of the monster class, while the snake monster class is introduced and given the S glyph.

Variants

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM introduces new monsters that use the s and S glyphs:

  • s arachnid or centipede
    • s recluse spider
    • s barking spider
    • s carrion crawler
    • s nickelpede
    • s giant scorpion
    • s Girtab
    • s Shelob
    • s phase spider
    • @ / s werespider
  • S snake
    • S king cobra
    • @ / S weresnake
    • S asphynx

AceHack

In AceHack, S can be used to quit with or without saving.

dNetHack

dNetHack introduces several new monsters that use the s and S glyphs:

  • s arachnid or centipede
    • s mirkwood spider
    • s phase spider
    • s demonic black widow
    • s mirkwood elder
    • s yurian
    • s Shelob
    • s man-faced millipede
  • S snake
    • S wraithworm
    • S serpent man of Yoth
    • S daughter of Naunet
    • S man-serpent soldier
    • S man-serpent mage
    • S man-serpent summoner
    • S man-serpent giant
    • S pisaca
    • S first wraithworm
